Articles.Content:
For some reason the internals in my game are failing and I have to take them out of the GameData folder. This has been going on since 1.1, even before I installed my mods. Please help!

Edited August 16, 2016 by BConn63
Failing in what way? you have to be more detailed than that .

19 hours ago, Jas0n said:

Failing in what way? you have to be more detailed than that .

The internals won't load when I try to start the game.

On 16/08/2016 at 5:11 AM, BConn63 said:

For some reason the internals in my game are failing and I have to take them out of the GameData folder. This has been going on since 1.1, even before I installed my mods. Please help!

 

14 hours ago, BConn63 said:

The internals won't load when I try to start the game.

Hi, we need to clear some stuff out of the way first , is this a game purchased through steam? or a KSP store game? It matters.   If it's a steam game have you re validated the files?  The first couple of times i installed the game through steam  there were parts missing and it took a couple of validations to get it all working correctly.  Do you have the game installed in a folder that is used by the operating system?  I'd expect not but having an install in one of the protected folder will prevent the game from working as external processes into that folder will be blocked. 

Do you have a log of an event in which the internals do not appear?  This could tell me pretty much instantly what is going on. 

If you had no mods installed there should only be the Squad folder in the Gamedata folder, certainly no internals folders.  So from where and why did you delete them? The fact that they don't display is not a reason to remove them, and removing them will cause an error to be logged  every time you viewed a craft. There is no valid reason except perhaps building a development build for fast loading in which it's not required to have all the parts, but unless you're seriously into developing mods the normal average Joe/Jane would never need to do this.

I have difficulty understanding how errors that appeared when you installed 1.1 still occurred in exactly the same way after 1.1.2 and 1.1.3. this leads me to believe that there is either something very wrong with how you have installed the game, or for some reason you've not got permission to access that file. Have you tried a new installation in a different location or drive?

Get a copy of your log, zip it up and make it available for download, so that i or someone else can look  through it properly, the answer lies there.

Edited August 17, 2016 by SpannerMonkey(smce)
